snippet: A former prime minister who has served in several high-ranking government positions emerged as the winner of the presidential election.
abstract: Former Prime Min Roch Marc Christian Kabore is elected president of Burkina Faso, becoming country's first new leader in 27 years; citizens celebrate remarkably calm and clean election in wake of recent unrest.

byline.original: By HERVÉ TAOKO and DIONNE SEARCEY
byline.contributor: Hervé Taoko reported from Ouagadougou, and Dionne Searcey from New York.

lead_paragraph: A former prime minister who has served in several high-ranking government positions emerged as the winner of the presidential election.

headline.main: Burkina Faso Elects First New Leader in Decades
headline.print_headline: Burkina Faso Elects 1st New Leader in Decades

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
